meanings.definition: The act or process of mesmerizing.
meanings.sent1: The mesmerism of the magician's tricks held the audience spellbound.
meanings.sent2: The mesmerism of the beautiful sunset captivated everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The mesmerism of the dancing cat was both amusing and puzzling.
meanings.sent4: The mesmerism of the ocean waves seemed to lull the beach into a peaceful trance.
meanings.sent5: The mesmerism of the campfire flames flickering created a calming effect on the group.

meanings.sent1: The mesmerism of the hypnotist put the volunteer into a deep sleep.
meanings.sent2: The mesmerism of the swinging pocket watch made the patient relax completely.
meanings.sent3: The mesmerism of the barking dog trying to hypnotize the mailman was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The mesmerism of the swirling vortex in the movie symbolized the character's inner turmoil.
meanings.sent5: The mesmerism of the flickering candle flame seemed to draw the viewer into a trance-like state.
